title: 80% of Workers Would Prefer a Vacation to a Raise
text:
80% of Workers Would Prefer a Vacation to a Raise 10/09/2015 - 12:42 PM EDT NEW YORK ( MainStreet ) -- Bosses, keep your pay raises. These days it looks like the American worker has other priorities . 
For years in jobs circles the conversation has remained focused on why U.S. wage growth has significantly underperformed an otherwise healthy job market. Economists have pitched theories all across the board, from a long-term shift in growth to a vast pool of workers still hanging outside the workforce to something new altogether. 
It’s an issue that dominated coverage of the recent Federal Reserve Board’s meeting and its decision not to raise interest rates. 
Yet while bankers braced themselves to learn the Fed’s opinion on wages relative to employment, businesses have focused somewhere else, with a steady number zeroing in not on paychecks but rather employee benefits. Perks such as free lunches, longer vacations and generous parental leaves have made headlines for companies such as Netflix and Google. More Headlines
